title: Almost 2,500 pounds of expired, unused drugs collected in Omaha area
title_page: Almost 2,500 pounds of expired, unused drugs collected in Omaha area
maintext:
Nearly 2,500 pounds of drugs were collected at 10 sites in the Omaha metro area on Saturday during a drug take-back event.
The drugs are mostly expired, unused or unwanted medications.
“The goal is to create that public awareness, to help them understand there are options to dispose of these legally,” said Jennifer Green, volunteer coordinator of the Livewise Coalition, which is dedicated to substance abuse prevention. “We are trying to divert these from the streets.”
Higher levels of antibiotics and hormones have been found in water supplies because some flush their medications rather than dispose of them properly, Green said.
Many local pharmacies will take back unused drugs, she said.
“Don’t just leave your medicine laying around in the house,” Green said. “There is no need to hang on to it.”
